ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English semen, from Old Norse sœma ('to conform to, befit'), from Proto-Germanic *sōmijaną ('to suit, befit'), from Proto-Indo-European *som-, *sem- ('together, one'). Influenced by Old English sēman ('to reconcile, arbitrate').

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To give the impression of being something; to appear to be.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She seems happy today, but I wonder why.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她今天看起来很高兴，但我想知道为什么。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Used to say that something appears to be true or to exist, often when you are not certain.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 看来，似乎（表示不确定或推测）
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: It seems that we have run out of time.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To be fitting or proper; to be appropriate.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 适宜，恰当；符合（某人的意愿）
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: It would not seem right to leave without saying goodbye.
